diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Fibromuscular dysplasia of the superior mesenteric artery
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with symptoms of ischemic colitis leading to an exploratory laparotomy that revealed gangrene of a segment of the small bowel. Pathological examination showed transmural infarction and stenotic changes in the mesenteric artery, consistent with fibromuscular dysplasia. Digital subtraction angiography displayed a characteristic 'chain of beads' appearance in the superior mesenteric artery, confirming the diagnosis.
